notes: XDMG text and rarity are preferred when available; non‑XDMG sources (e.g., CRCotN, XGE, BGG, BMT) are used only when XDMG lacks an equivalent.
Placeholders like {N} and {LEVEL} are meant to be substituted by the builder UI.
appliesTo values: 'weapon', 'armor', 'shield', 'ammunition'. Optional 'requires' can narrow to weapon families like 'sword'.

textByKind.weapon: You have a +{N} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
textByKind.shield: While holding this shield, you have a +{N} bonus to Armor Class.
textByKind.ammunition: You have a +{N} bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition; once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.
textByKind.armor: You have a +{N} bonus to Armor Class while wearing this armor.

textByKind.weapon: This weapon is made of adamantine. Whenever it hits an object, the hit is a Critical Hit.
textByKind.ammunition: This piece of ammunition is made of adamantine. Whenever it hits an object, the hit is a Critical Hit.
textByKind.armor: While you wear this armor, any Critical Hit against you becomes a normal hit.

textByKind.weapon: An alchemical process has bonded silver to this magic weapon. When you score a Critical Hit against a shape‑shifted creature, roll one additional damage die of the weapon’s normal damage type.
In darkness, the unsheathed blade sheds Bright Light in a 15‑foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 15 feet.

As a Bonus Action, toss this weapon to hover and attack within 5 feet of itself (using your attack roll and adding your ability modifier to damage). As a Bonus Action, you can move it up to 30 feet and have it attack. After its fourth attack it flies back to you; it ceases hovering if you grasp it or you are more than 30 feet away.

While holding this magic weapon, you can use a Bonus Action and a command word to ignite flames. The weapon sheds Bright Light in a 40‑foot radius and Dim Light for 40 feet. While ablaze, it deals an extra 2d6 Fire damage on a hit. The flames last until you use a Bonus Action to extinguish them or you drop/stow/sheathe the weapon.
This magic weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage to any creature it hits. The extra damage is of the weapon’s normal type.

You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and the weapon ignores Resistance to Slashing damage. When you attack a creature with at least one head and roll a 20 on the d20 for the attack, you decapitate it (if it can’t survive without its head). Otherwise, the target takes 30 Slashing damage. A creature with Legendary Resistance can instead expend a use to avoid decapitation and take the extra damage.
Against objects, maximize the weapon’s damage dice on a hit. On a 20 on the d20 for an attack roll against a creature, the target takes an extra 14 Slashing damage and gains 1 level of Exhaustion.

When you attack a creature and roll a 20 on the d20 for the attack, the target takes an extra 15 Necrotic damage if it isn’t a Construct or an Undead, and you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to the Necrotic damage dealt.

On a hit, the target takes an extra 2d6 Necrotic damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save or be unable to regain Hit Points for 1 hour. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Curse: you’re unwilling to part with the weapon and have Disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons other than this one. On taking damage in combat, succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom save or you must attack the creature that damaged you until it or you drop to 0 HP or you can’t reach it. Remove Curse ends the attunement; Banishment on the weapon also ends the curse.

While the weapon is within your reach and you are attuned: Alarm—each sleeping subject you choose is awakened when combat begins; Supernatural Readiness—each subject has Advantage on Initiative rolls.

textByKind.ammunition: This ammunition is keyed to a creature type chosen when created. If a creature of that type takes damage from it, it makes a DC 17 Constitution save, taking an extra 6d10 Force damage on a failed save (half on success). After dealing its extra damage, the ammunition becomes nonmagical.
A creature hit by this ammunition must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or have the Prone condition.
Ranged attacks made with this ammunition ignore half and three‑quarters cover. Attacking at long range doesn’t impose Disadvantage.

textByKind.armor: While wearing this armor, you have Resistance to {OPTION} damage.
While wearing this cursed armor, you have Resistance to {OPTION} damage. Curse: you have Vulnerability to the other two physical damage types until the curse is removed.
You have a Swim Speed equal to your Speed. If you start your turn underwater with 0 Hit Points, you immediately regain 1d4 Hit Points. The armor can’t heal again until the next dawn.
Mithral is a light, flexible metal. If the base armor normally imposes Disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks or has a Strength requirement, the mithral version doesn’t.
Wisps of harmless, odorless smoke rise from this armor while it is worn.
You have Advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and Dexterity saving throws. Once per dawn, you can cast Wind Wall (save DC 15) from the armor.

textByKind.weapon: While this weapon is on your person, you and Fey understand one another’s non‑written communication. Once per dawn, you can use a Magic action to cast Message from the weapon.

variants.name: Enspelled Weapon
variants.schools: Conjuration, Divination, Evocation, Necromancy, or Transmutation

textByKind.weapon: Bound into this weapon is a level {LEVEL} spell from {SCHOOLS}. The weapon has 6 charges and regains 1d6 charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast the bound spell (save DC {DC}, attack bonus +{ATK}).

textByKind.armor: Bound into this armor is a level {LEVEL} spell from {SCHOOLS}. The armor has 6 charges and regains 1d6 charges daily at dawn. While wearing it, you can expend 1 charge to cast the bound spell (save DC {DC}, attack bonus +{ATK}).

You have Resistance to Psychic damage, a Swim Speed equal to your Speed, and can breathe water. Ruidium Corruption: when you roll a 1 on a saving throw while wearing this, make a DC 15 Charisma save or gain 1 level of Exhaustion (also become corrupted if not already). If ruidium is destroyed in the world, this becomes +1 armor.

textByKind.weapon: You can breathe water and have a Swim Speed equal to your Speed. Ruidium Strike: a creature you hit takes an extra 2d6 Psychic damage. Ruidium Corruption: when you roll a 1 on an attack with this weapon, make a DC 20 Charisma save or gain 1 level of Exhaustion (also become corrupted if not already). If ruidium is destroyed, this becomes a +2 weapon.

textByKind.armor: You can doff this armor as a Magic action.

textByKind.weapon: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can’t regain Hit Points until the start of your next turn.
